name: tgtop11
body: |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, ctop), wceq(cfv(ctg, c0), cfv(ctg, c1))), wceq(c0, c1))
bodyPretty: ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Top ∧ c1 ∈ Top ∧(topGen ` c0)=(topGen ` c1))→ c0 = c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, ctop), wceq(cfv(ctg, c0), cfv(ctg, c1))), wceq(c0, c1))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(c0, ctop), wcel(c1, ctop)), wb(wceq(cfv(ctg, c0), cfv(ctg, c1)), wceq(c0, c1)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, ctop), wceq(cfv(ctg, c0), c0))
-| wi(wcel(c1, ctop), wceq(cfv(ctg, c1), c1))
body.pretty:
⊢ ((c0 ∈ Top ∧ c1 ∈ Top)→((topGen ` c0)=(topGen ` c1)↔ c0 = c1))
⊣ (c0 ∈ Top →(topGen ` c0)= c0)
⊣ (c1 ∈ Top →(topGen ` c1)= c1)

comment: The topology generation function is one-to-one when applied to completed topologies. (Contributed by NM, 18-Jul-2006.)
